snippet: The Mets’ acquisitions over the past 17 months provide a stark narrative of just how much the club’s financial issues have restricted Sandy Alderson in his job as general manager.
abstract: New York Mets general manager Sandy Alderson, since being hired in Oct 2010, has overseen the team’s acquisition of roughly two dozen players with some form of major league pedigree; has been obligated to take a payroll that exceeded $140 million and cut it to about $90 million--the kind of reduction that is only possible by repeatedly acquiring players who cost very little.
lead_paragraph: The Mets’ acquisitions over the past 17 months provide a stark narrative of just how much the club’s financial issues have restricted Sandy Alderson in his job as general manager.

headline.seo: Alderson Is Forced to Remake Mets on the Cheap
headline.main: Budget-Challenged Alderson Remakes the Needy Mets
headline.print_headline: Budget-Challenged Alderson Remakes The Needy Mets
